it.unimi.di.law.bubing

Class StartupConfiguration

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.unimi.di.law.bubing.StartupConfiguration

  • public class StartupConfiguration
extends Object
    A class whose public fields represent the configuration of BUbiNG at startup.

    All public fields of this class represent a configuration property:

    • their type must be either a primitive type or String;
    • their name coincides (case-sensitively) with the name of the keys of the property file used to configure BUbiNG (see below);
    • although fields are all public and non-final, they should only be written by the constructors of this class; every other access should be read only.

    For integer or long fields, the configuration values are passed to a IntSizeStringParser or LongSizeStringParser, respectively. Thus, you can use any size specification allowed by those parsers such as K (103), Ki (210), M (106), Mi (220), etc.

    Note that all fields are mandatory unless marked with a StartupConfiguration.OptionalSpecification annotation: if a non-annotated field is missing, or if it is of the wrong type, or if it fails to satisfy the extra condition required for that field, a ConfigurationException will be thrown. The same is happen if one specifies an unknown field.

    Fields marked with a StartupConfiguration.ManyValuesSpecification annotation can be specified multiple times. As usual, you can also enumerate several values separated by a comma.

    Internals

    If a field named xxYyyZzzz requires some additional check (e.g., that its value is set in a certain range), a method named checkXxYyyZzzz with signature 

     public void checkXxYyyZzzz() throws ConfigurationException
    should be added to this class: this method should throw an exception if the field fails to satisfy the required condition; it may also perform some logging.

    A configuration is constructed by reflection using one of the class constructors. The StartupConfiguration(Configuration) takes a Configuration and sets the fields by reflection (field names are used to look up for properties in the given configuration, and the values found are used to initialize the corresponding fields).

    A number of facility constructors are provided that read the configuration from a file (provided as a file or as a filename) in the classic properties format.

    Moreover, some additional constructors are provided that read the configuration from a file and possibly change some of them; see for example StartupConfiguration(String, Configuration).

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  StartupConfiguration.FilterSpecification
      A marker for filter specifications.
      static interface  StartupConfiguration.ManyValuesSpecification
      A marker for specifications that may have multiple values.
      static interface  StartupConfiguration.OptionalSpecification
      A marker for optional specifications with a default parameter.
      static interface  StartupConfiguration.StoreSpecification
      A marker for the Store class.
      static interface  StartupConfiguration.TimeSpecification
      A marker for time specifications; such specification are by default in milliseconds, but it is possible to use suffixes ms (milliseconds), s (seconds), m (minutes), h (hours) and d (days).

      A filter that will be applied to all ready URLs to decide whether to fetch them.

      The number of fetching threads (hundreds or even thousands).

      A filter that will be applied to all fetched resources to decide whether to parse them.

      A Parser specification that will be parsed using an ObjectParser.

      The number of parsing threads (usually, the number of available cores).

      The proxy host, if a proxy should be used; an empty value means that the proxy should not be set.

      The proxy port, meaningful only if proxyHost is not empty.

      int weight
      The weight of this agent; agents are assigned a part of the crawl that is proportional to their weight.
      long workbenchMaxByteSize
      The maximum size of the workbench in bytes.

        public long keepAliveTime
        If zero, connections are closed at each downloaded resource. Otherwise, the time span to download continuously from the same site using the same connection.

        The minimum delay between two consecutive fetches from the same scheme+authority.

        public double bloomFilterPrecision
        The precision of the Bloom filter used for duplicate detection (usually, at least 1/maxUrls).

      • seed

        public String[] seed
        A URL from which BUbiNG will start crawling. If it starts with file:, it is assumed to point to an ASCII file containing on each line a seed URL.

      • blackListedIPv4Addresses

        public String[] blackListedIPv4Addresses
        An IPv4 address that should be blacklisted (i.e., not crawled). If it starts with file:, it is assumed to point to an ASCII file containing on each line a blacklisted IPv4 address.

        public String[] blackListedHosts
        A host that should be blacklisted (i.e., not crawled). If it starts with file:, it is assumed to point to an ASCII file containing on each line a blacklisted host.

        The socket timeout.

        The socket connection timeout in milliseconds.

        public int fetchDataBufferByteSize
        Size of the buffer for InspectableFileCachedInputStream instances, in bytes. Each fetching thread holds such a buffer.

        The maximum overall size for the (external form of) the cookies accepted from a single host.

      • userAgent

        public String userAgent
        The User Agent header used for HTTP requests.

      • userAgentFrom

        public String userAgentFrom
        The From header used for HTTP requests. It can be empty, in which case no From header will be emitted.

      • robotsExpiration

        public long robotsExpiration
        The delay after which the robots.txt file is no longer considered valid.

      • rootDir

        public String rootDir
        A root directory from which the remainig one will be stemmed, if they are relative. Note that this directory can be preexisting, and can be just a dot, denoting the current directory.

      • storeDir

        public String storeDir
        A directory where the retrieved content will be written. It must not exist.

      • responseCacheDir

        public String responseCacheDir
        A directory where the content overflowing the in-memory buffers of FetchData instances (of fetchDataBufferByteSize bytes) will be stored using an InspectableFileCachedInputStream. It must not exist.

      • sieveDir

        public String sieveDir
        A directory for storing files related to the sieve. It must not exist.

      • frontierDir

        public String frontierDir
        A directory for storing files (mainly queues managed by ByteArrayDiskQueue) related to the frontier. It must not exist.

      • responseBodyMaxByteSize

        public int responseBodyMaxByteSize
        The maximum size (in bytes) of a response body. The exceeding part will not be stored.

      • digestAlgorithm

        public String digestAlgorithm
        The algorithm used for digesting pages (for duplicate filtering).

      • parserSpec

        public String[] parserSpec
        A Parser specification that will be parsed using an ObjectParser.

      • startPaused

        public boolean startPaused
        Whether we should start in paused state.

        The class used to Store the resources.

        The maximum size of the workbench in bytes.

      • virtualizerMaxByteSize

        public long virtualizerMaxByteSize
        The maximum size of the virtualizer in bytes; this field is ignored if the virtualizer does not need to be sized.

      • urlCacheMaxByteSize

        public long urlCacheMaxByteSize
        The maximum size of the URL cache in bytes.

      • sieveSize

        public int sieveSize
        The number of slots in the sieve. A flush happen when this space is filled with 64-bit hashes. Note that due the needs of indirect sorting 12 bytes will be allocated for each slot.

      • sieveStoreIOBufferByteSize

        public int sieveStoreIOBufferByteSize
        The size of the two buffers used to read the 64-bit hashes stored by the sieve during flushes. Will be allocated using ByteBuffer.allocateDirect(int).

      • sieveAuxFileIOBufferByteSize

        public int sieveAuxFileIOBufferByteSize
        The I/O buffer used to write the auxiliary file (containing URLs) and to read it back during flushes.

      • dnsCacheMaxSize

        public int dnsCacheMaxSize
        Maximum number of entries cached by the DNS resolutor.

      • dnsPositiveTtl

        public long dnsPositiveTtl
        Expiration time for positive DNS answers.

      • dnsNegativeTtl

        public long dnsNegativeTtl
        Expiration time for negative DNS answers.

      • crawlIsNew

        public boolean crawlIsNew
        See Also:

    • Constructor Detail

      • StartupConfiguration

        public StartupConfiguration(Configuration configuration)
                     throws ConfigurationException,
                            ClassNotFoundException
        Populate the object fields starting from the given configuration. The configuration should contain at least one entry for every public instance field of this class, whose name and type coincide with the name and type of the given field.

        Field are parsed in the standard way (i.e., we invoke Configuration's methods such as Configuration.getDouble(String)) with the exception of integer and long fields, which are passed to a IntSizeStringParser and LongSizeStringParser, respectively. Thus, you can use any size specification allowed by those parsers.

        Parameters:
        configuration - the configuration on the basis of which this object should be constructed.
        Throws:
        ConfigurationException - if some field is not set, or if it has the wrong type, or if it fails to satisfy the corresponding check... method.
        IllegalArgumentException
        ClassNotFoundException

      • StartupConfiguration

        public StartupConfiguration(File file,
                    Configuration additionalProp)
                     throws ConfigurationException,
                            IllegalArgumentException,
                            ClassNotFoundException
        Creates a configuration starting from a given file and possibly adding and/or overriding some properties with new values.
        Parameters:
        file - the file whence the base configuration should be read.
        additionalProp - the set of additional properties, some of which may override the values found in the file.
        Throws:
        ConfigurationException - if some field is not set, or if it has the wrong type, or if it fails to satisfy the corresponding check... method.
        IllegalArgumentException
        ClassNotFoundException

        public static ArrayList<Parser> parsersFromSpecs(String[] specs)
                                          throws IllegalArgumentException,
                                                 ClassNotFoundException,
                                                 IllegalAccessException,
                                                 InvocationTargetException,
                                                 InstantiationException,
                                                 NoSuchMethodException,
                                                 IOException
        Given an array of parser specifications, it returns the corresponding list of parsers (only the correct specifications are put in the list.
        Parameters:
        specs - the parser specifications (they will be parsed using ObjectParser.
        Returns:
        a list of parsers built according to the specifications (only the parseable items are put in the list).
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException
        ClassNotFoundException
        IllegalAccessException
        InvocationTargetException
        InstantiationException
